title: Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) is down -1.41% in a Week, Should You Sell?
text:
A rating of 97 puts Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) near the top of the Internet Content & Information industry according to InvestorsObserver. Alphabet Inc Class C's score of 97 means it scores higher than 97% of stocks in the industry. Alphabet Inc Class C also received an overall rating of 75, putting it above 75% of all stocks. Internet Content & Information is ranked 83 out of the 148 industries.





 GOOG has an Overall Score of 75. Find out what this means to you and get the rest of the rankings on GOOG!
See Full GOOG Report


What do These Ratings Mean?

Finding the best stocks can be tricky. It isn’t easy to compare companies across industries. Even companies that have relatively similar businesses can be tricky to compare sometimes. InvestorsObserver’s tools allow a top-down approach that lets you pick a metric, find the top sector and industry and then find the top stocks in that sector.



 

Our proprietary scoring system captures technical factors, fundamental analysis and the opinions of analysts on Wall Street. This makes InvestorsObserver’s overall rating a great way to get started, regardless of your investing style. Percentile-ranked scores are also easy to understand. A score of 100 is the top and a 0 is the bottom. There’s no need to try to remember what is “good” for a bunch of complicated ratios, just pay attention to which numbers are the highest.

What's Happening With Alphabet Inc Class C Stock Today?
Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) stock is trading at $145.06 as of  10:49 AM on Thursday, Feb 22, an increase of $1.22, or 0.85% from the previous closing price of $143.84. The stock has traded between  $144.01 and $146.20 so far today. Volume today is less active than usual. So far 6,025,501 shares have traded  compared to average volume of 21,804,608 shares.
